record.author: Barlow 2024; Barlow & Killian 2023a, b; Grace 1955; Parkinson 1907; Ross 1977-1982
record.notes:
Barlow, Russell. 2024. Tomoip morphological sketch. Language and Linguistics in Melanesia 42: 41–93. https://hdl.handle.net/21.11116/0000-000E-6677-A.
Barlow, Russell, and Don Killian. 2023a. Tomoip wordlist: Based on elicitation sessions with Simon Mangil from Milim village, recorded in Kokopo, East New Britain, October to November 2022 (v1.0.2). https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8437515.
Barlow, Russell, and Don Killian. 2023b. Tomoip phonetics and phonology. Te Reo 66(1): 60–96. https://hdl.handle.net/21.11116/0000-000D-F9B0-3.
Grace, George W. 1955. Columbia University notebook, pt. 3. In The George Grace linguistic research and slides of Melanesia collection, 1955–1956: Online documents. Unpublished MS. https://digital.library.manoa.hawaii.edu/grace/docs.
Parkinson, Richard. 1907. Dreißig Jahre in der Südsee: Land und Leute, Sitten und Gebräuche im Bismarckarchipel und auf den deutschen Salomoinseln. Stuttgart: Strecker & Schröder.
Ross, Malcolm. 1977–1982. Konomala Mamusi Uvol Tomoip. XWAV/MPEG/PDF/TIFF/JPEG. MR1-012 at catalog.paradisec.org.au. https://doi.org/10.4225/72/56FFE00776765.
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Western Oceanic, Meso Melanesian, New Ireland

record.annotation: < *la-lma; /la-/ = class term for baskets, open things
'knowledge, wisdom; custom, tradition; heart (metaphorical) (?)'; loan from Kol?
'to bake in an earth oven'; /to/ 'to do, to make' + /ŋ-hum/ 'earth oven'
pandanus sp. used for thatch roofs
'vine with thorns used to make needles'
causative prefix /βa-/ ?; with /ne=ban/ ‘the light’, i.e., ‘to cause the light’?
class term for long things, trees, plants
loan from Lote [pɛr-] 'arm, branch' or Kol [pɛr] 'hand'?
class term for fruits, round things, bunches
salt made from ashes; literally 'black salt'?
from Grace; 'black; all'; loan from Kol?
from Grace: <mɛgɔlgɔl>; reduplication; loan from Sulka?
same form as 'to turn, to say'
from Grace; 'black; all'; loan from Kol?
loan?; retention of 'five', despite change in form of 'hand' and loss of 'three' and 'four'?
ad hoc formulation?; 'five one'?; /liem/ a loan?
from Ross; 'five one and one'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'five two'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'five two-and-another'?; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'five two and two'; /liem/ a loan?

record.item: liem denan mo horo mo horo
record.annotation: from Ross; 'five one and two and two'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'two five'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'two five two'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'five one'; /liem/ a loan?
from Ross: <roliem kere> ; 'two-five all'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'two five two and two'; /liem/ a loan?
ad hoc formulation?; 'PL five two and two'; /liem/ a loan?
from Grace: <lie̯m> ; ad hoc formulation?; ‘five’; loan?
